item.title: Report I-2025010030
item.description:
Report I-2025010030

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: QATAR AIRWAYS CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: MAWB 157-02144601 15pc, 1682KG ORD/MXP QR8112/12JAN25 HAWB S25CH100041 8pc 1068KG Upon screening of above MAWB, agents discovered an RPB label on inner contents of shipment 1 skid. Shipment was placed on hold. No declaration on MAWB for dangerous goods. Review of HAWB manifest revealed declaration of"Empty Buckets and Lids". QR inspected package which appeared and confirmed to be empty. Appears to be used bucket shipping to MXP, unknown if contains RPB residue. Shipment kept on hold UFN.

item.title: Report E-2025010166
item.description:
Report E-2025010166

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: HAMPSHIRE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately eight (8) ounces of material released from one (1) 275-gallon IBC poly tote due to a gash at the top of the tote. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010114
item.description:
Report E-2025010114

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-09
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pail being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010086
item.description:
Report E-2025010086

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-06
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 6, 2025, five (5) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately ten (10) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010091
item.description:
Report E-2025010091

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-08
  • City: GILSON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EnviroMark was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 50ft-by-10ft of the trailer floor and 20ft-by-2ft of the soil beyond the shoulder and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to a single vehicle accident that resulted in one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. EnviroMark personnel deployed granular absorbent to the impacted areas and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized the recovered material into six (6) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum and two other impacted drums were overpacked into three (3) 95-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.
